content: tthhee kknniitt ccyyccllee ziggo hat i ve been knitting for my kiddo since before he was born when he was a baby it was fun to be able to put him in just about ridiculous thing that struck my fancy as a toddler things temporarily got a bit less fun but now it s super exciting to be able to consult with him and design to his specifications the ziggo hat was co-created with my son he doesn t knit yet but he chose the colors for the original described what he wanted in the stripes chose the final striping chart from several samples i drew out for his consideration and gave feedback every step of the way our first but hopefully far from our last collaboration the colorwork is simple but striking the repeat is short as can be easy to read your work as you go and soothingly rhythmic making it an ideal introduction to stranded colorwork and possibly just a little bit addictive it also uses only a small amount of the contrast color making it a great stash buster for using and highlighting the last of a favorite beautiful color we hope you enjoy it as much as we do -- tag #theknitcycledesigns so we can see your fo materials yarn knit picks wool of the andes or other smooth worsted / light worsted yarn in two constrasting colors you will need approximately 100 110 140 yards of mc and 23 25 28 yards of cc needles dpn or circular needles for working in the round a for the body and crown us 7 4 5mm or as needed to obtain gauge b us 5 3 75mm or two sizes smaller than needle a c optional for cast on us 3 3 25mm or two sizes smaller than needle b notions stitch markers six total with one distinct for beginning of round tapestry needle gauge 21 st and 27 row per 4 in measured over stockinette on needle a largest needle cast on note this pattern recommends an italian
